metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 34 axioms covering plan failure explanation patterns and three-way failure classification based on causal complexes
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities, causal complexes, and goal-action causation

axioms.title: Definition of tryBy
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (tryBy a e e1 s) (exists (e2 e3) (and (causalComplex' e2 s e)(member e1 s)(agentOf a e1) (believe a e2)(goal' e3 e a)(cause e3 e1)))))
axioms.english: For agent a to try to achieve e by doing e1 is for a to believe that e1 is in a causal complex s for e and for a to do e1 where a's having the goal e causes a to do e1.

axioms.title: Definition of failBy
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (failBy a e e1 s) (and (tryBy a e e1 s)(not e))))
axioms.english: To fail when trying by some means can be defined as trying without the goal coming to exist.

axioms.title: Definition of failType1
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (failType1 a e e1 s) (and (failBy a e e1 s)(not (causalComplex s e)))))
axioms.english: A type 1 failure can be defined as failing to achieve the goal e because s is not a causal complex for e.

axioms.title: Definition of failType2
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (failType2 a e e1 s) (and (failBy a e e1 s) (exists (e2) (and (member e2 s)(not e2))))))
axioms.english: A type 2 failure happens when eventualities in s other than e1 do not hold.

axioms.title: Definition of failType2a
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (failType2a a e e1 s) (and (failType2 a e e1 s)(hope a s)(not (believe a s)))))
axioms.english: A type 2a failure is where a fails to achieve e by means of e1 where a hopes but does not believe that s holds. An example of this is a 'Hail Mary' pass.

axioms.title: Definition of failType3
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (iff (failType3 a e e1 s) (exists (e2 e3 e4 s1) (and (failBy' e2 a e e1 s)(failBy' e3 a e1 e4 s1) (cause e3 e2)))))
axioms.english: A type 3 failure is the recursive case. The agent a fails to achieve e by means of e1 because a fails to achieve e1. The failure to achieve e1 could be a type 1, 2, or 3 failure.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Moderate use of primed predicates for mental processes: causalComplex', goal', failBy'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: No axioms use (etc) condition - all failure type definitions are strict logical classifications
conversion_notes.failure_taxonomy: Comprehensive 15-category taxonomy of plan failure causes organized into 3 fundamental types
conversion_notes.causal_complex_theory: Failure analysis grounded in causal complex theory from Chapter 15
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integration with belief systems (Chapter 21), goal theory (Chapter 28), emotion theory (Chapter 49 for 'hope')
conversion_notes.recursive_structure: Type 3 failures allow recursive failure chains where achieving subgoals fails
conversion_notes.ai_research_integration: Synthesis of Yale/Northwestern AI research on explanation patterns from 1990s
conversion_notes.practical_applications: Three applications: case indexing, explanation generation, explanation recognition

file_format_notes.axiom_numbering: Sequential numbering from 34.1 to 34.6 (only 6 FOL axioms despite extensive taxonomic content)
file_format_notes.logical_structure: Relatively simple logical structures with clear hierarchical failure type definitions
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of failure terminology with clear semantic distinctions between types
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: No defeasible rules - all axioms are strict logical definitions
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Minimal reification focused on causal complex beliefs and failure events
file_format_notes.taxonomic_integration: Extensive natural language taxonomy (15 categories, 47+ subcategories) with minimal formal axiomatization
